course_title: Special Topics in Music: Creative Musician Film Scoring
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course will explore different techniques for film scoring, focusing on how to utilize one's unique musical voice in storytelling for film. Students will learn how to compose in a DAW with sample libraries, recording techniques, improvisation for film scoring, and how to compose both to picture and from a script or concept. In this course students will work individually and in groups on creative film scoring projects, in addition to learning through analysis of film scores, the psychology of storytelling, and from guest speakers. Each student will finish the course with a small portfolio of new works. This course is open to both composition and performance majors interested in film scoring.
